Jaggery helps regulate menstrual cycles due to its warming effects.
Buttermilk contains lactic acid that normalizes the acidity in the stomach.

Being rich in vitamin C, cashew nuts stimulate the nervous system.
Breathing exercises can help improve breathing in people suffering from COPD.

How can I find a solution for my problem at Pink Shastra?

You may consult an expert in your chosen category, and also find a medicine by exploring the therapeutic classification of the medicines. Else one can search by typing name of the disease, symptom or product in the ‚Äúsearch‚Äù option available on the homepage.
Do I need prescription from doctor to buy medicine at Pink Shastra?
No. Homeopathic medicines being OTC in nature can be bought without a prescription. However, it is always better to consult a physician and should not do self-medication.
Should I stop my current allopathic medicines?

No. If anyone is on long continued prescription allopathic or any other mode of treatment, then she should not stop her current medicine. However, one can use homeopathic medicine as an adjuvant to the current medicines.
Are there any side effects of natural medicine?

Usually natural medicines do not have any side effects. But there are very rare possibilities of aggravation of the symptoms. If aggravation continues for longer period then one should stop the medicine and should immediately consult a physician.
How should I take the Medicine?
As per the dose mentioned on the pack of that particular medicine, though the expert will also recommend the method.
Are there any Dietary Restrictions with Natural Medicines?

No. However it is recommended that there should not be any strong smell in mouth like of garlic, mint and onion etc. while taking medicines. Further, one should avoid eating anything 15 minutes before and after taking the medicine. If there is any such restriction, our expert will inform in advance.
How much time it will take to cure my disease?

The time taken mainly depends upon the condition of the patient and severity of the disease. If the condition is not severe then it may improve in few days but if the condition is severe then it may take longer time.
Should I continue the Medicines indefinitely?
No. One must take the medicine for the duration advised by the expert. You can follow up with the expert after that for further advise.
How I should store the Medicines?
Store in a dry place at room temperature away from the sun and strong perfumes. Not in refrigerators.
